text:
I was attempting to install the tomcat service for windows jk_nt_service on 
windows 2000. I'd placed the wrapper.properties in the following directory. 
e:\sdks\jakarta-tomcat-3.3-m\conf\jk. I installed the service using this 
directory as the path to the wrapper.properties. I then tried to start the 
service using the 'net start' command, it failed to start and informed me that 
no error was produced. 

I tried this several times making sure that the wrapper.properties was correct. 
It then struck me that the Sun JDK 1.3 has problems with long file names, so 
may be that was causing the problem. I determined the dos name for each 
directoy and this gave me the following path e:\sdks\JAKART~1.3-M\conf\jk. I re-
installed the service, and it started successfully.

I've no problem with having to change the directory but it would have saved me 
some time if this problem had been documented some where.
